pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Is there any reason not to add this instance?
If you add this instance, then given `[IsROrC K] [NormedSpace K E]`, Lean will search for, e.g., `NormedSpace (ULift (ULift (ULift Real))) E`
The data which annoys me (because a large chunk of the theorems about IsROrC do not need it, and we are going to pay for this later) is the choice of sqrt(-1); maybe this should be mentioned?
I added a paragraph about this. You may add a paragraph about why it's bad (what price are we going to pay for this), e.g., in the not-yet-written `### TODO` section of the module docstring.
I added a paragraph about AlgebraicClosure(Real) in the module docstring.

```suggestion
it does not just claim the existence of these operations.
```
I don't know what "as an assumption of an instance" means :-(

See #10524 for an example (I hope, it'll work). Suggestions about better wording are very welcome.
UPD: it failed. I'll have another look tomorrow.

```suggestion
must agree with the corresponding instances for `ℝ` and `ℂ`.
```

pullRequest.title: doc(IsROrC): expand the docstring
